alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cocke; Jefferson; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 3:57PM CST until February 27 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Knox County in east Tennessee... Blount County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 456 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles east of Eagleton Village, or 10 miles east of Alcoa, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Winds in excess of 70 miles per hour recorded at Knoxville airport. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Maryville, Sevierville, Alcoa, Newport, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Rockford, Parrottsville, Eagleton Village and Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 430 and 451. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
